p: Territory of Washington vs. E. Romick} Evidence of the defendant witnesses on the examination of E. Romick. C.F. Bassett Reside at Sprague and Agt. N.P.R.R.-attend to freights to serving bills need & checked know deft.- know 5,000 cigars-several days agp unloading freight-noticed a case of cigars missing car was sealed & missing-found with & moving that soul had happened with- examined & found this case had been was missing after examined & sealed & found seal had been cut discovered then the seal was perfect in evening-Goodson posi- tion of N.P. Better from Portland to G.W. Rich Cheney -saw bill-box was kept goods laid over from morning car laid over from morning to next morning-Found this out & kept car over. Geo Meyer Reside at Spraque - warehouse was & seal clerk for N.P.R.R. Co. Car freight marked G.W. Rich Cheney= Box marked G.W. Rich with brush-better from Portland to CHeney-saw it from Car No. 11302-Feb 17- providing to resealing car sealed with rivet-pressed- together good seal 23-exam- ined next day-good= keep record-found seal drawn through the cachet & car drawn through holes-lead the gone=I then looked in car & witheld case of cigars gone- marked T.J. checks it over from was bill John Cody Sheriff of Lincoln Co. W.T. Day before yesterday-I was informed cigars stolen & asked look walls up - x investigated & found there at an old cloth book of Nelson loving Smith-belongs to Kilton recite in left of name & if of pay out-97 or 99 boxes over above branded "No Boxes"-Deft. told me where to find them. I have reason to believe that he knew where the cigars were= I asked him- He said what cigars= How do you know= I have sworn to believe it= what do about it= said again said if I found cigars no arrest it left me I would go to get them= Mr. Maloney Depty. Sheriff arrested me= he said couldn't prove he broke into a car or took any cigars: but I know where they are- Told him that all I wanted= to know where they were- Found in S. Kelton's stable-Deft. is sworn in law to S Kelton Cross: Weight about 200 lbs- couldn't carry about didn't deft said where they were but didn't tell me where they were told him I had the word of Agt. that if they were dug up he would make no arrests. I intended to deft. that he deft. was suspected. By court: Found in stable- not all cigars=got work in Guering house Found no more of same brand M.J. Maloney I am Depty Sheriff Lincoln Co. W.T. I saw Sheriff Feb 25 I said to help him move cigars I heard his testimony &I thought about his testimony I never spoke deft. about the matter brand Albanese. M.T. Hardlaw I saw the cigars first in Mr. Cody's office about 100 boxes=Albanese Deft said to me I didn't steal them but knew the person who did & they wanted a place to put them then told them a good place- before they were stolen= he told them to put them in the barn or place where thye found= they were put there based to conersation. But Hardlaw These cigars Cross Jas N. Ryan # are worth about Co to 70 per thousand J.W. Ryan I deal in cigars thignors (here witness examined box) they are worth from- 50.00 to 60.00 per box Cross 1000 would weigh about- 150 lbs Meyers recalled This carried on Sprague Lincoln Co. W.T. Cross Saw weight on way bill- 170 lbs Defense Freidland Are acquained with deft. saw him in Dillons on Eve of 17th after dark- dont know when he left there. over Defense J.J. Maloney Know deft. saw him on eve 17th- I think_ saw him at Dillons- don't know how long he stayed- I left early- to go to enter trainmark He was there when I left W.R.S Kelton Know deft= Fold want to correct & cause home 1 two o'clocl. He came in four minutes before & made here & then he and his wife went up to his room. He was at home so far as I know. - I think I should have known if he went out= He was there in morning when I got up. Came in about 9 o'clock- I know because his wife & my wife want to converse J.C. Burns: Depty. Sheriff-know deft. Saw him at Dillons Salon on eve of 17th Where did you find him- next he try to get away saw him on train ex train going west
